element.BriefDescription:
Nitrogen is a common element in the universe, estimated at about seventh in total abundance in our galaxy and the Solar System. It is also abundant on Earth, forming around 80% of Earth's atmosphere.

At room temperature, it is a gas of diatomic molecules and is both colorless and odorless.

The extremely strong bond in elemental nitrogen dominates nitrogen chemistry, causing difficulty for both organisms and industry in converting the N 2 into useful compounds, but at the same time causing release of large amounts of often useful energy when the compounds burn, explode, or decay back into nitrogen gas.
